snippet: A cease-fire in Gaza collapsed on Friday as the Israeli military said that two soldiers had been killed and a third apparently captured. Gaza health officials said at least 70 Palestinians had been killed by Israeli airstrikes.
abstract: Palestinian militants clash in Rafah, Gaza, killing two Israeli soldiers and capturing Second Lt Hadar Goldin, in attack that curtails 72-hour cease-fire and escalates 25-day battle between Hamas and Israel; Israel retaliates with assault that kills 70 people and injures 350; episode dims hope that conflict may end soon.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Fares Akram from Gaza, Peter Baker from Washington, Michael R. Gordon from Ramstein Air Base, Germany, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: A cease-fire in Gaza collapsed on Friday as the Israeli military said that two soldiers had been killed and a third apparently captured. Gaza health officials said at least 70 Palestinians had been killed by Israeli airstrikes.

headline.main: Gaza Fighting Intensifies as Cease-Fire Falls Apart
headline.print_headline: Gaza Fighting Intensifies as Cease-Fire Falls Apart
